net.xuset.objectIO.util

Class AsynchronousUrlReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.util.AsynchronousUrlReader

  • public class AsynchronousUrlReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class reads the contents addressed by a given url. The reading happens in a separate thread. The contents can be read by calling getContents(). This method will return an empty string until the thread finishes reading. Before trusting that the String returned by getContents() is accurate, make sure isFinished() is true and encounteredError() is false.

    AsynchronousUrlReader is backed by a URL.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
      The default amount of time to wait while reading the received data in milliseconds.

      Constructs a new AsynchronousUrlReader with the given url, buffer size, and timeout.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsynchronousUrlReader

        public AsynchronousUrlReader(java.lang.String url,
                     int bufferSize)
        Constructs a new AsynchronousUrlReader with the given url and buffer size. A default timeout of 3000L milliseconds is used.
        Parameters:
        url - string url to read the contents from
        bufferSize - the max buffer size

      • AsynchronousUrlReader

        public AsynchronousUrlReader(java.lang.String url,
                     int bufferSize,
                     long timeout)
        Constructs a new AsynchronousUrlReader with the given url, buffer size, and timeout.
        Parameters:
        url - string url to read the contents from
        bufferSize - the max buffer size
        timeout - the max amount of milliseconds to finish reading from the url

    • Method Detail

      • getContents

        public java.lang.String getContents()
        Returns the contents that have been read.
        Returns:
        the contents read from the source or an empty string if the reading has not finished

      • reachedEndOfStream

        public boolean reachedEndOfStream()
        Returns true if the end of stream was reached before running out of space allocated for the buffer.
        Returns:

        Returns the exception that was encountered.
        Returns:

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Indicates if reading the contents has finished
        Returns:
        true if the reading has finished
